answers.answer: Hi.During exercise, the liver can be stimulated to break down glycogen stores to produce glucose.In type 1 diabetes, especially in those with poor metabolic control, the elevation in blood glucose levels is caused by exaggerated hepatic production of glucose and impairment in exercise-induced glucose utilization.Hope this answers your query.

question: Hi i am pooja my husban is 25 yrs old n is a type 1 diabetic i wanted o knowHis sugar leve is 100 before exercise but once he finishes his exercise it rises to 300 what can be the reason? please can u help me out with this as this is happening every day since a weekTo:
